content.question: Which of the following best explains a neo-Malthusian perspective on the Green Revolution?

choices.label: The Green Revolution represents a jump in agricultural technology, but population will still grow faster than our ability to produce food will over the long run.
The Green Revolution solves the entire problem of feeding the planet, and Malthusian ideas are no longer relevant.
Local food production is the key to long-term food production.
The distribution of food in a capitalist system results in too many people being unable to afford basic foods.
The increase in the food supply and a resulting increase in the population available for farm labor will solve the food crisis.

content.answer: The Green Revolution represents a jump in agricultural technology, but population will still grow faster than our ability to produce food will over the long run.
